result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Hommrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Paid out of bond.  Defendant is ordered to pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge, provide a sample for testing through the Dept. of Corrections as required in felony convictions.
Defendant must maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Defendant to attend and participate in sex offender treatment, to have a  mental health assessment and follow all recommendations.  Defendant to participate in any counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent, releasing all records to the agent.

Defendant is to abstain from the consumption of any alcohol and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
Defendant is to have no contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior permission from the agent.
The defendant shall have no contact with the victim Rebecca Hurd or Kari Rogers of any kind, including in person, in writing, by phone,by e-mail, or through a third party.
Defendant is not to possess or use a computer, software, hardware, modem or video recording devise.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
